intro: Chironia baccifera var. dilatata, commonly known as the broad-fruited chironia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its large, showy flowers and woody stems. The plant produces clusters of fleshy, berry-like fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and conservation efforts.
